abstract: The public opposition by Davis Selected Advisors poses a serious problem for Transatlantic as it tries to fend off a hostile bid by Validus Holdings.
snippet: The public opposition by Davis Selected Advisors poses a serious problem for Transatlantic as it tries to fend off a hostile bid by Validus Holdings.
lead_paragraph: Transatlantic Holdings‘s biggest shareholder, Davis Selected Advisors, said on Thursday that it opposed the insurer’s proposed $2.9 billion merger with Allied World Assurance.

headline.main: Transatlantic’s Biggest Investor Opposes Allied Deal

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
